ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Research skills, data analysis, executing an entire research process by myself.

I sharpened my coding and analytical skills, and learned how to build and wrangle a data set. This thesis also challenged me to draw upon both empirical and theoretical lessons that I encountered during my time at Yale, and made me apply them to real-world concepts. I found that economics research was immensely fulfilling despite never having done it before.

I think writing a senior essay forces you to learn to work independently, and to figure out what works to keep you productive and on schedule. I definitely learned a lot about what it means to do independent research and about everything that goes into actually writing the essay.
Econometrics, public health and rigorous data work
getting to know all steps of the econ research process from data collection/cleaning to formatting a final report in latex

It's really just a continuation of Econ 491, but I guess I ended up spending more time on it this semester. You learn how to write an economics essay -- that includes analyzing data (possibly) or theory, writing a paper, doing lit review, etc.
Everything that goes into economic research!
How to conduct economic research and write a research paper
Research
How to develop an economics research paper
How to write a senior thesis and how to set my own deadlines
Details of the economics research process including technical skills, i.e. data cleaning, outputting tables and such, etc., and also information about the literature on my particular topic.
How to do independent research

I learned about how to find a research topic, how to find data to suit your research topic, how to present ideas into a cohesive manner, and ultimately how to summarize research into a concise research paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I wonder if the Econ department can follow the example of other departments that celebrate the culmination of thesis work, for example, through a formal presentation / lunch gathering, etc. The thesis is a very time-consuming process, in addition to the fact that only a small percentage of Econ majors choose to write the thesis, and I think this deserves to be celebrated. To my knowledge, only the essays selected for prizes are publicly acknowledged, but I believe there should be more opportunities to learn about work from the entire thesis writing cohort.
I think that the course is really perfect -- I loved the fall optional lectures!

I think the strengths and weaknesses are pretty obvious, the strengths being that there is no better way to learn how to do research than to actually do it on your own, and the weaknesses being that a it can be difficult to start, and it can sometimes feel isolating working by yourself on something that has a deadline months in advance.
It was very engaging to be given the opportunity for hands on Economic research
it's hard to say because the quality is very advisor-based and I happened to have a really good one

Strengths: get to write an econ paper. I also like how early the essay is due (April 5 this year). It allows for a much more relaxing finals period and end of semester broadly. Weaknesses: it's a lot of work, but you know what you're signing up for, so not sure that really counts.
So much support from the department - up to you to find a good advisor

Strengths: you learn a lot through independent work
Weaknesses: your thesis experience is very dependent on your advisor

Gives you free reign to explore an economics question, learn by doing, gives you real, practical exposure. 

Would have been beneficial to have more guidance on analysis techniques beyond DiD and regression discontinuity designs. Maybe more on general regression analysis, probability regresssion, fixed effects, etc.
It is both a strength and weakness to have so much flexibility --- but still very fulfilling course!
getting data is really difficult, but the process was rewarding
The strength is simply the advisor system where I am able to receive constant feedback from a professor.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, writing a thesis is a very fulfilling experience. It's worth noting, however, that this a very self-driven process, so it's best to front load more work instead of having them pile up closer to the deadline.

Absolutely! I came in with no economics research experience, but the thesis turned out to be one of my favorite academic experiences at Yale. You learn so much by doing it -- and I encourage those on the fence to give it a shot.
I would definitely recommend this, but only if you are enthusiastic about doing research on your own!
Yes!! It is a great way to cap off your Yale Economics journey, and a very fulfilling 2 semesters

if you're interested in pursuing econ research beyond senior year via grad school or a think tank job, definitely. if you're not, I think a lot of the work here is too Econ Academic Writing To Practice Making Something You'd Submit To A Journal to have future application, but maybe you'd also have fun as long as your senior year courseload isn't too heavy

Yes, if they want to write an essay. If they are not up for the time commitment, then maybe not. If they do write an essay they should do 2 semesters. Even that I felt still left more work and future questions that would be answerable -- I don't think you can really do a thorough job in 1 semester.
Yes - need a good advisor though
Yes - writing a thesis is very rewarding.
Yes!
Yes, very fulfilling to carry out a project and have ownership over it.
Absolutely - you have to be willing to put in the work though and get the help and support you need (if you need it!)

Yes, definitely. Writing a senior essay was one of the best parts of my Yale experience. The process of finding and analyzing data and engaging with the literature on a highly specific topic of interest is very exciting, and this is a great opportunity to work closely with an economics faculty member.
Yes, learning to do independent research is a cool skill and gives you more ownership of your work than a bunch of problem sets
Yes, writing the senior essay was one of my hallmark experiences at Yale. It allowed me to delve deep into a topic I am interested in and to conduct original research.
